title: How to Remove Wax from Concrete

steps.title: Rent a commercial steamer.
steps.content: Rent a commercial steamer. Such appliances are usually available at large hardware/home improvement stores and some supermarkets.

steps.title: Steam the spot until the wax starts to melt.
steps.content: Steam the spot until the wax starts to melt.

steps.title: Keep steaming until most to all of the wax has melted.
steps.content: Keep steaming until most to all of the wax has melted. Wipe it with an absorbent material. Repeat until all the wax is removed. Repeat as required.

steps.title: Layer several pieces of kitchen paper towel or brown paper, or a terry towel rag over the wax stain.
steps.content: Layer several pieces of kitchen paper towel or brown paper, or a terry towel rag over the wax stain. Prepare a bottle of mineral spirits and a bucket of dish detergent and warm water, at the ready. [2] X Research source The towel rag will absorb more wax than the paper, but use what you have available.

steps.title: Heat the iron on a hot setting.
steps.content: Heat the iron on a hot setting.

steps.title: Iron over the paper.
steps.content: Iron over the paper. The wax will melt underneath. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the heat and the paper layers.
steps.content: Remove the heat and the paper layers. Quickly mop up the melted wax using paper towel or rags and the mineral spirits.

steps.title: Remove the mineral spirits with the detergent and warm water.
steps.content: Remove the mineral spirits with the detergent and warm water. Mop it all up and allow to dry. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Prepare the cleansers.
steps.content: Prepare the cleansers. Have a bottle of mineral spirits and a bucket of warm water with detergent at the ready.

steps.title: Use a putty knife or similar scraper to remove as much wax as possible.
steps.content: Use a putty knife or similar scraper to remove as much wax as possible. Discard this into the bin.

steps.title: Place a terry towel rag over the top of the wax.
steps.content: Place a terry towel rag over the top of the wax. This will absorb a lot of what melts, reducing how much mopping up you'll need to do. This step is optional but advisable; if you don't have this towel, you can still heat the wax directly.

steps.title: Set the hair dryer to its hottest temperature.
steps.content: Set the hair dryer to its hottest temperature. Hold over the wax to melt it. Go over it as much as is needed to melt the most wax. [5] X Research source You'll need to lift up the terry toweling rag to check you're getting it all.

steps.title: Wipe up the melted wax with the mineral spirits and a rag or kitchen paper towel.
steps.content: Wipe up the melted wax with the mineral spirits and a rag or kitchen paper towel. Clean away the mineral spirits with the detergent and warm water. Allow to air dry. [6] X Research source
